titleStmt.title: An epitome of the history of faire Argenis and Polyarchus, extracted out of the Latin, and put in French, by that great and famous writer, M. N. Coeffeteau Bishop of Marseilles. And translated out of the French into English by a yong gentlevvoman. Dedicated to the Lady Anne Wentvvorth
Histoire de Poliarque et d'Argenis. English
titleStmt.author: Coeffeteau, Nicolas, 1574-1623.
Man, Judith.
Barclay, John, 1582-1621. Argenis.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E. G[riffin] for Henry Seile at the Tygers head in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: A prose summary of: Barclay, John. Argenis.
Translation of: Coeffeteau, Nicolas. Histoire de Poliarque et d'Argenis.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
